item.title: SIP Trunking and Internet On a T1
item.description:
Many smaller companies utilize T1 lines for dedicated internet access, opting for this solution after experiencing unreliable or unavailable consumer-grade broadband options. T1 lines offer these businesses dependable, robust bandwidth at increasingly affordable prices. However, many are unaware that they can bundle their broadband and telephone services onto a single T1 line. Traditional T1 lines offer various service options. The original format, designed for the telephone industry, provides 24 channels of digitized telephone service over two pairs of twisted copper phone wires...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/sip-trunking-and-internet-on-a-t1/

item.title: Why NOT to Buy a New PBX
item.description:
Traditionally, businesses dealing with outdated or inadequate phone systems have opted for a complete replacement, known as a “forklift upgrade.” While this provided enhanced performance and capacity, like a brand new car, there’s a compelling alternative in today’s world: hosted PBX solutions. Rather than investing heavily in another physical PBX system, consider a hosted PBX, also referred to as Hosted VoIP or PBX in the cloud. This service eliminates the need for a physical PBX on your premises...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-not-to-buy-a-new-pbx/

item.title: Business Broadband and Phone Comparison
item.description:
Small and mid-sized businesses require both internet and phone service. While ordering these services separately remains an option, businesses now have more choices. Bundled services, offering both phone and internet, often make the most sense for smaller businesses with limited needs and budgets. Two primary bundled options provide cost savings compared to separate services. The first option, known as Integrated T1 or SIP Trunking, utilizes line sharing but differs in connection methods...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/business-broadband-and-phone-comparison/
